page.title: 04Housing in Kirk Sandall
page.content: The houses in this part of Kirk Sandall are known locally as "Pilk's houses".This is because they were built by{Pilkington brothers},glass manufacturers,to house the workers from their new factory which came to Kirk Sandall in 1920.Over 2,000 houses were planned for the new{"Garden {Village"}along with many other amenities.However by 1923 the plant at the new works had become obsolete and the driving force behind the village had been lost and Pilkington's began to sell the houses. Some 500 houses were built and of the amenities which were provided the{bowling greens and {pensioner's club}are still enjoyed today. Kirk Sandall is no longer a company village but a commuter suburb for Doncaster.
